posts.name: 6894 Lead prog/driver
posts.cooked: Rule G302 was really unclear if it is allowed

posts.name: Max Vrany
posts.cooked:
Condition V:

do not include any form of enabled wireless electronic communication with the exception of medically required equipment

posts.name: 6894 Lead prog/driver
posts.cooked: What if the audio is coming straight from the laptop speakers and not earbuds?

posts.name: FrankJ
posts.cooked: Then it is no longer wireless and does not violate that rule. You could also plug in headphones.

posts.name: 6894 Lead prog/driver
posts.cooked: Nice, time to find some good wired earbuds so I can give one ear to each driver

posts.name: Kabir
posts.cooked: I considered this a while ago. It does seem legal, but the earbuds would have to be initially taken off per 6.3.2 (“devices worn or held by their HUMAN PLAYERS and/or DRIVERS during the MATCH must be disconnected from or set on or beside the OPERATOR CONSOLE before the MATCH can begin.”) and then put into the ears after auto ends.

posts.name: EricH
posts.cooked:
I’m going to say you don’t want to do that.

First, the drivers can’t wear them during Auto. Second, there’s a possible safety hazard when someone yeets backwards accidentally.

It’s not illegal, but I’m not sure I’d want to do that.

posts.name: Kabir
posts.cooked: The operator station laptop getting pulled away could be avoided by using a magnetic breakaway adapter for the cables (there are USB ones, or there might be some that can directly connect to earbuds).

posts.name: 6894 Lead prog/driver
posts.cooked: I am curious as to how to program it since the code is running on the robot and not the laptop

posts.name: FrankJ
posts.cooked: Not being connected either to the person or laptop during Auto is both correct and a different rule. Being a good idea and legal is different subject. Making on  sound on laptop triggered by the robot is what programers are for.  We use haptics (?-vibrations) on the game pad controls for much the same thing. Doesn’t have the issues of being heard in a noisy environment.

posts.name: jace
posts.cooked: i would think that i could be done in one of the dashboards and have it activate on a trigger like when something true or false not really familiar with how they work though I’ve done something similar with a touch sensor but that made a light turn from red to green

posts.name: Joe Ross
posts.cooked: Making a Shuffleboard plugin play sounds Programming

link_counts.title: Making a Shuffleboard plugin play sounds

posts.name: 6894 Lead prog/driver
posts.cooked: Thanks, will definitely look into this. Now I just need to contact first about some of the legality

posts.name: FrankJ
posts.cooked: Q&A is the correct method to ask rule related questions.

posts.name: MrRoboSteve
posts.cooked: Keep in mind that it’s often very loud in the driver station.

posts.name: 6894 Lead prog/driver
posts.cooked: That’s why I wanted earbuds and not just laptop speakers
